translated: O Shakra! If touched by an outcaste, one should perform the Japa of the Aghora mantra three thousand times.

analyzed: jñātvā na atra prakarttavyam prāya cittam surādhipaḥ

original: annādyaṃ madirā spṛṣṭaṃ yadi bhukte tvakāmataḥ /🔽viṇmūtraretasā spṛṣṭaṃ līḍhaṃ vā kākakukkuraiḥ //

translated: or if it is touched by the remnants of a Shudra or by extremely low-caste people,

analyzed: kṛtvā snānam nirāhāraḥ kipi grāha śilā dakṣe paṃcagavyam samācaret
translated: having bathed, fasting, one should perform the five products of a cow for a crocodile, a jackal, a stone, and an elephant.

analyzed: iti japet ghoram samāhitaḥ  p

analyzed: upavāsam tathā naktam pañcagavyam

analyzed: japtvā ghora nirāhāraḥ pañcagavyena na śudhyati  arddha ucchiṣṭaḥ yadā mantrī viṣṭha madya ādinā hataḥ
translated: Having muttered the terrible (mantra) without food, one is not purified by the five products of the cow.🔽When the mantrin (is defiled) by half-eaten food, or struck by feces, wine, etc.,

analyzed: strī jape ghoram pañcagavyena śudhyati  vinā yajñopavītena pivati bhuṃkte yadā naraḥ
translated: and also by the fault of a woman, having muttered the terrible (mantra), he is purified by the five products of the cow.🔽When a man drinks or eats without the sacred thread,

analyzed: paṃcagavyam nirāhāraḥ japtvā ghoram viśuddhi ati
translated: having muttered the terrible (mantra) without food, he is purified by the five products of the cow.

analyzed: ucchiṣṭaḥ tu yadā spṛṣṭam ucchiṣṭaiḥ veṇukā ādibhiḥ
translated: When one is touched by leavings, by leavings of bamboo, etc.,

analyzed: snānam śaucam pañcagavyam japāt śuciḥ
translated: having bathed, purified oneself, fasted, and muttered the five products of the cow, one is pure.

analyzed: ghoṣa arka rukā raupyāṇāmi aṅga śīśakayoḥ api  p
translated: Of conch shells, mother-of-pearl, silver, and also of bamboo and cane,

analyzed: vāriṇā
translated: O Hari, the determination of purity is as follows:

analyzed: śaṃkha sāmvu kanśuktīnām tejasa vat śuddhiḥ iṣyate
translated: Of conch shells, mother-of-pearl, and oysters, purity is considered to be like that of fire.

analyzed: kathitam śudhyate kṣīram dadhi śuddhiḥ nigadyate
translated: The purification of milk has been told. The purification of curd is being told.

original: dadhipīḍāntare dhṛtvā vīkṣayet tadanantaraṃ //🔽annādi lepanirmuktamprokṣaṇācchudhyate dadhi /
analyzed: anna ādi lepa nirmuktam prokṣaṇāt śudhyate dadhi
translated: Having kept it in a curd-press, one should examine it afterwards.🔽Curd is purified by sprinkling, being freed from stains of food, etc.

analyzed: su taptasya śrutasya atha śuddhi rājyasya kīrttitā
translated: The purification of ghee that is well-melted and strained is declared.

original: evaṃ madhuguḍādīnāṃ prokṣaṇādagni yogataḥ /🔽sabhṛṇā caiva sukṣodāsotsiṣṭānu sa lepikā //🔽sabhṛṇā prokṣaṇācchuddhā sa kṣaudāmārjanādhikā /
analyzed: evam madhu guḍa ādīnām prokṣaṇāt agni yogataḥ  ca eva sukṣodā asā utsiṣṭā anu  prokṣaṇāt śuddhā sa kṣauda āmārjana adhikā
translated: Similarly, honey, jaggery, etc., by sprinkling and contact with fire,🔽and also the remnants of food mixed with curds, are purified by sprinkling.🔽That which is mixed with curds is purified by sprinkling, and that which is mixed with sour milk is purified by wiping.

analyzed: sa ucchiṣṭā gomayaḥ pūrva saṃskāra sodhinā
translated: That which is defiled by remnants of food is purified by cow dung, and that which is defiled by previous contact is purified by the prescribed purification.

analyzed: anyat śuddha antaram vakṣye samāsāt pākaśāsana
translated: O chastiser of Paka, I shall now tell you about another internal purification, in brief.

original: susnānaśca samācāntaḥ śuddha vā sā śuciḥ pumān //🔽pitṛdevopayuktānāṃ pratyahaṃ śauca miṣyate /
analyzed: su snānaḥ ca samācāntaḥ pumān  pitṛ deva upayuktānām pratyaham śauca miṣyate
translated: A man who has bathed well, sipped water, and is pure or clean,🔽is considered to be pure daily for the use of ancestors and gods.

original: tyāgo paridhāna vastrāṇāṃ prāvaraṇasya vajrā game //
analyzed: paridhāna vastrāṇām prāvaraṇasya vajrāḥ game
translated: The abandonment of worn-out garments and the covering cloth is recommended.

original: rajaka kṣālitaṃ vastrampunarddhautamviśuddhyati /🔽carmaṇā raktaṃ vastrāṇāṃ śuddhiḥ kṣāravāriṇā //🔽kauśeyāmvikayorukṣaiḥ kṣaumāṇāṃ gaurasarṣapauḥ /
analyzed: rajaka kṣālitam vastram punar ddhautam viśuddhi ati  carmaṇā raktam vastrāṇām śuddhiḥ kṣāra vāriṇā  kauśeya āmvikayā urukṣaiḥ kṣaumāṇām gaurasarṣapauḥ
translated: A garment washed by a washerman becomes pure again by being washed once more.🔽The purification of woolen garments is by alkaline water.🔽For silk and cotton garments, it is by alkaline substances. For linen garments, it is by white mustard seeds.

analyzed: śrīphalaiḥ aṃśupahānām kutapānām mariṣṭakaiḥ  tṛṇa kāṣṭha ādikam sarvam prokṣaṇāt śuddhim eva hi
translated: For garments removed by the sun, it is by margosa leaves. For woolen garments, it is by margosa fruits.🔽All grass, wood, etc., become pure by sprinkling.

analyzed: śuddhānām saṃhatānām tu prokṣaṇāt śuddhiḥ iṣyate
translated: For the pure, the purification of the collected is considered to be by sprinkling.

analyzed: saṃhatānām bahūnām tu yat yat lopena dūṣitam
translated: If many things are mixed together and one of them is spoiled,

original: tatra tyaktvā tṛṇādīnāṃ śodhayet sādyathā śuci //
analyzed: tatra tyaktvā tṛṇa ādīnām śodhayet sā āt yathā śuci
translated: then having discarded the grass etc., the remaining things should be purified and made pure.

original: kāru hastā karaṃ dravyaṃ śuddhaṃ paśya prasāritaṃ /
analyzed: kāru hastā karam dravyam śuddham paśya prasāritam
translated: O Indra, the pure substance should be seen spread out by the hand of the priest.

analyzed: phalānām kṣālanāt śuddhiḥ vinā a doṣam purandara
translated: The purification of fruits is by washing, except in the case of faults.

analyzed: daśa ahāt śudhyate vipraḥ dvādaśa ahe na bhūmipaḥ
translated: A Brahmin becomes pure after ten days, a king after twelve days,

analyzed: vaiśyaḥ pañcadaśa ahena śuddhiḥ śūdrasya a māsikā
translated: a Vaishya after fifteen days, and a Shudra becomes pure after a month.

analyzed: anuṣṭhāna vihīnānām jāti mātraḥ purandara
translated: O Indra, for those devoid of performance, only caste remains.

analyzed: veda vedāṅga sampanna snu āhitāgniḥ tu sa dvijaḥ
translated: But he is a true Brahmin who is endowed with the Vedas and Vedangas and has established the sacred fire.

analyzed: tad kṣaṇāt snānāt jñātvā anyatra prakalpayet  p
translated: He becomes pure instantly by bathing, knowing otherwise one should arrange accordingly.

analyzed: asadyapāḥ kulīnāḥ ca nityam dharma parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Those who are not engaged in sinful acts, who are of noble birth, and who are always devoted to Dharma,

analyzed: śūdrā śudhyanti pakṣeṇa na atra kāryāt vicāraṇāt
translated: Shudras become pure after a fortnight, no doubt should be entertained in this matter.

original: udvāhitāścatasro vai brāhmaṇe na sadāstriyaḥ //🔽sūtakantu kramāt tāsāṃ daśaṣaṭdvyekavāsaraṃ /
analyzed: udvāhitāḥ catasraḥ vai brāhmaṇe na sadā striyaḥ  sūtakam tu kramāt tāsām daśa ṣaṣ dvi eka vāsaram
translated: Four types of women are considered as wives by Brahmins:🔽The period of impurity for them is respectively ten, six, two, and one day.

analyzed: dvyena śudhyate vṛddhiḥ na śavaḥ
translated: A child is purified by the mother, a mother by the child; a cow by water, and a Shudra by death.

analyzed: sūtakam
translated: For those with light, when increasing and decreasing, there is no pollution.

analyzed: nṛpāṇām kārukāṇām vā dāsīnām ca na sūtakam
translated: For kings, artists, or female slaves, there is no pollution.

original: mṛtake tu pṛthakyākaṃ kuryād yogaṃ na taiḥ saha /
analyzed: mṛtake tu pṛthakyākam kuryāt yogam na taiḥ saha
translated: But in the case of death, one should perform the rites separately, not with them.

original: tyaktanna cedatau jāti tadā śuddhirbha / t //
analyzed: tyaktat na ced atau tadā
translated: If not abandoned, then the purification is by that caste.

analyzed: śuṃsanāt pūrṇagarbhasya snānā deva viśuddhi ati
translated: By shaving, a full-term fetus, one is purified by bathing.

original: jīvañjāto yadi śeyānmṛto vā jāyate yadi //
analyzed: jīvan jātaḥ yadi śeyāt mṛtaḥ vā jāyate yadi
translated: If a living child is born, or if a dead one is born,

original: sā vā śaucaṃ na kartavya / samācaret /
analyzed: sā vā śaucam na      samācaret
translated: that one should not perform the purification, but should observe it.

original: anāya karaṇāt sadya ekāho danta janmanaḥ //
analyzed: anāya karaṇāt sadyas eka ahaḥ danta janmanaḥ
translated: Because of not causing it, it is immediate. For the birth of teeth, it is one day.

analyzed: cūḍāyāḥ tri dinam proktam tatra āmitya adhikam vratāt
translated: For the tonsure, it is said to be three days. There, it is more than that due to the vow.

analyzed: pūrvavat śuddhiḥ sarva varṇeṣu iyam sthitiḥ
translated: Up to that, the purification is as before. This is the rule for all castes.

analyzed: ahanta dviguṇam bhavet
translated: For a maiden, it would be double until the teeth are cut.

analyzed: śvasṛ ādiṣu ca mātulānām ca mātule
translated: And this should be known for sisters-in-law and so on, and for maternal uncles.

original: deśāntare pṛthak piṇḍe snānaṃ syāt tadguruṃ vinā /
analyzed: deśa antare pṛthak piṇḍe snānam syāt tad gurum vinā
translated: In a different country, in a separate funeral cake, there would be bathing, except for that teacher.

original: paśutvaṃ kṛtaṃ yeṣāṃ samyag nirvāṇa dīkṣayā //
analyzed: paśu tvam kṛtam yeṣām samyak nirvāṇa dīkṣayā
translated: For those whose animal nature has been made by the perfect initiation of liberation,

original: tasya saṃparka śūnyasya na syātāṃ mṛtasūtake /
analyzed: tasya saṃparka śūnyasya na syātām mṛta sūtake
translated: there would be no pollution due to death or birth for one who is devoid of contact with that.

original: ataśca parataḥ śakrasaṃpūjyaḥ sūtake sati //🔽parānna bhojane nityamparātra dravinaḥ kriyaḥ /
analyzed: atas ca paratas śakra saṃpūjyaḥ sūtake sati  para anna bhojane nityampara atra dravinaḥ kriyaḥ
translated: Therefore, in the case of pollution, one should be worshipped by others than Śakra.🔽One should always eat the food of others, and one's own wealth should be used for others.

analyzed: gṛhasthaḥ sarva karmāṇi nityā      varjayet
translated: A householder should always avoid all actions.

analyzed: dravyaiḥ pūrvam sūtakāt mṛtakāt api
translated: With substances previously resolved upon, even from pollution and death,

original: dharmārthaṃ dīkṣitaiḥ pūjā kāryā conyāditaistathā //🔽pṛthak pākaṃ vinā pumbhirlokadīkṣānu sāribhiḥ /
analyzed: dharma artham dīkṣitaiḥ pūjā kāryā conyā āditaiḥ tathā  pṛthak pākam vinā pumbhiḥ loka dīkṣā anu sāribhiḥ
translated: Worship should be performed for the sake of Dharma by those initiated and by others.🔽Without separate cooking, by men who follow the worldly initiation,

analyzed: antaryāgaḥ prakartavyaḥ japa snāna ādikā kriyā
translated: The inner sacrifice should be performed, and the rites of japa, ablution, etc.

analyzed: prāyaścittam samādeśya na anyathā niścitā sthitiḥ  p
translated: Expiation should be prescribed, otherwise the established position is not valid.

original: evaṃ hi varttamānasya tridhā siddhirna dūrataḥ /
analyzed: evam hi varttamānasya tridhā siddhiḥ na dūratas
translated: Thus, for one who conducts oneself in this way, success in three ways is not far away.

analyzed: duḥsvapna darśane naraitā ud sarge śatakrate
translated: If a bad dream is seen by men, it should be recited at the beginning of the creation of Śatakratu.

analyzed: aghora aṣṭa śatam jāpyam tathā
translated: The Aghorāṣṭa-śata should be recited, and then the Sambhāṣya-rādhaka.

original: adbhiḥ saṃśudhyate mātraṃ sa leṣantaṃ mṛdamvubhiḥ //
analyzed: adbhiḥ saṃśudhyate mātram sa mṛdamvubhiḥ
translated: One is purified by water, and by earth and water when one is defiled.
If the wealth of the deity, Caṇḍa, and the Guru is eaten without being drunk,

original: lakṣapādaṃ tadā deyaṃ dviguṇaṃ naiṣṭhike mataṃ //
analyzed: lakṣa pādam tadā deyam dviguṇam naiṣṭhike matam
translated: Then a lakh of padas should be given, and twice that is considered for one who is steadfast.

analyzed: atha ākramya su nirmālyan japet pañca śatāni tu
translated: Then having taken the used garland, one should repeat the mantra five hundred times.

analyzed: triguṇam kāmataḥ jñeyam pañcagavya samanvitam
translated: If done out of desire, it should be known to be three times that, along with the five products of the cow.

analyzed: saṃspṛṣṭam tadā jīvitā
translated: If one touches what has been touched by a used garland, then one should fast.

analyzed: nirmālyam dāna laṃghāna bhakṣaṇāt
translated: The used garland should be reduced by one-eighth due to giving, jumping, and eating.

original: laṃghayed yastu nirmālyaṃ dadyādajñānatopi vā /🔽guṇāyutaṃ japed ghoraṃ tathā yoṣyadvidhāśruti //
analyzed: laṃghayet yaḥ tu nirmālyam dadyāt ajñānataḥ api vā  guṇāyutam japet ghoram tathā
translated: One who violates the used garland, or even gives it unknowingly,🔽should repeat the terrible mantra ten thousand times, and likewise should follow the injunctions of the scriptures.

analyzed: nirmālya sparśane  sa vikārasya yaḥ toyan tathā ikṣu hiṃgu jīrakam
translated: If one touches a used garland, one should discard the merchandise, medicine,🔽water of transformation, sugarcane, asafoetida, cumin seed,

original: saindhavādyaṃ sa karpūraṃ kaṭukādyaṃ sa vraṇulaṃ /
analyzed: saindhava ādyam sa karpūram kaṭuka ādyam sa vraṇulam
translated: rock salt and other spices, camphor, bitter substances and other herbs,

analyzed: aṣṭam ca candanam bhasma veṇu mṛd maya dāravam
translated: and the eight types of sandal paste and ash, as well as bamboo, clay and wood.

original: sarvaṃ tyājyaṃ samuddiṣṭaṃ dhānyādi proṣitaṃ śuciḥ /
analyzed: sarvam tyājyam samuddiṣṭam dhānya ādi proṣitam śuciḥ
translated: All of this is to be discarded. Grain and other things are pure when stored.

original: evamanyatra boddhavyaṃ jñātvā dravyavalāvalaṃ //🔽śodhayet sarvadā dhīmānna śuddhe vandhanaṃ dhruvaṃ /
analyzed: evam anyatra boddhavyam jñātvā dravya valāvalam  śodhayet sarvadā dhīmān na śuddhe vandhanam dhruvam
translated: In the same way, one should understand elsewhere, knowing the strength and weakness of the substances.🔽The wise one should always purify, for in an impure state there is certainly bondage.

original: drutaṃ yasyāpavargecchā sa śuddhau kṛta niścayaḥ //
analyzed: drutam yasya apavarga icchā sa śuddhau kṛta niścayaḥ
translated: One who desires liberation quickly is determined in purification.

original: kāmato garbhapātācca tṛtīyasyāyutaṃ japet /🔽dhenuṃ pramādato hatvā hyaghorālakṣataḥ śuciḥ //🔽dhenunāñca śataṃ datvā lakṣādāpyatha śudhyati /

translated: For intentionally causing an abortion, one should repeat the mantra ten thousand times.🔽Having unintentionally killed a cow, one becomes pure by reciting the Aghora mantra one lakh times.🔽Having given away one hundred cows, one becomes pure by reciting the mantra one lakh times.

original: bhukte bhukto tu śūdrasya sahasrāt kāmataḥ śuciḥ //🔽karmaṇā manasā cā sādhakādiṣu śvedane /
analyzed: bhukte tu śūdrasya sahasrāt kāmataḥ śuciḥ  karmaṇā manasā ca sādhaka ādiṣu śvedane
translated: If a Shudra is unintentionally killed while eating, one becomes pure by reciting the mantra one thousand times.🔽In the case of Sadhakas etc., one should act in accordance with the rules, mentally and physically.

original: samācāret tathā kiñcinnirvedaṃ yena jāyate //🔽kṛtvā purā trirātrantu dvātriṃśārṇā yutācchuciḥ /
analyzed: samācāret tathā kiñcid nirvedam yena jāyate  kṛtvā purā dvātriṃśa arṇā yutāt śuciḥ
translated: One should do something that leads to renunciation.🔽Having observed a three-night fast, one becomes pure by reciting the mantra thirty-two thousand times.

original: devālaye tu yaḥ kuryāt purīṣaṃ mantrameva vā //
analyzed: devālaye tu yaḥ kuryāt purīṣam mantram eva vā
translated: One who defecates or urinates in a temple,

analyzed: devatāḥ yatane rāme śiva kṣetre viśeṣataḥ
translated: especially in a temple of Shiva, O Rama,

analyzed: sahasram ekam japtavyam akāmāt pādataḥ śuciḥ
translated: should recite the mantra one thousand times. If done unintentionally, one becomes pure by reciting half the number.

original: śūdraṃ vālakaṃ hatvā kāmato kāmatopi vā /
analyzed: śūdram vālakam hatvā vā
translated: If a Shudra boy is killed intentionally or unintentionally,

analyzed: lakṣam ekam kramāt japtvā tad arddhe kāmatas
translated: one should recite the mantra one lakh times in order, or half that number if unintentional.

original: nādhikāre hyanu / ne daśāhaṃ vai bhaved dvijaḥ /
analyzed: na adhikāre hi anu daśa aham vai bhavet dvijaḥ
translated: If one is not authorized, one should observe a ten-day fast.

analyzed: dvādaśa aham nṛpasya evam vaiśyaḥ pañcadaśa āhnikam
translated: A Brahmin should observe a twelve-day fast, a Kshatriya a fifteen-day fast,

original: nivarttate tu nityādi śūdre māsaṃ na cānyathā /
analyzed: nivarttate tu nitya ādi śūdre māsam na ca anyathā
translated: But for a Shudra, the impurity lasts for a month, not otherwise, in the case of a daily obligatory rite.

analyzed: nirvāṇa dīkṣitānām tu sūtakam na eva vidyate
translated: For those initiated into the path of liberation, there is no impurity at all.

analyzed: vidyate sūtakam teṣām loka dīkṣā anusārataḥ
translated: For them, there is impurity according to the initiation of the world.

original: śikhācchedo na tatrāsthi dīkṣā sā lokikī matā //
analyzed: śikhā chedaḥ na tatra asthi dīkṣā sā lokikī matā
translated: The cutting of the tuft there is not with bone; that initiation is considered worldly.

analyzed: antaryāga prakarttavyaḥ lokikaiḥ eva dīkṣitaiḥ
translated: The inner sacrifice should be performed by those initiated in the worldly way.

analyzed: japam pradakṣiṇa ādīni karttavyāni prayatnataḥ
translated: Japa, circumambulation, and so on should be performed with effort.

analyzed: brahmacārī gṛhasthasya kvacid
translated: The food of a householder is sometimes edible for a celibate, but not for a forest-dweller or ascetic.

analyzed: vānaprastha yatīnām tu pūrvavat dakṣiṇam japet
translated: For forest-dwellers and ascetics, the southern japa should be done as before.

original: tathānya liṅgināṃ bhuktvā sahasraṃ dakṣiṇaṃ japet /
analyzed: tathā anya liṅginām bhuktvā sahasram dakṣiṇam japet
translated: Similarly, having eaten with those wearing other emblems, one should do the southern japa one thousand times.

original: dvijātaiścopa vā setu vihitastā dṛśo japaḥ //
analyzed: dvijātaiḥ ca upa vā setu vihitaḥ tāḥ dṛśaḥ japaḥ
translated: The japa prescribed by the learned is to be done even by those who have violated their vows.

analyzed: yaḥ mohāt guru pādaiḥ ca mohataḥ śapatham vadet
translated: One who out of delusion would utter an oath at the feet of the Guru,

original: dadāti cānyo duṣṭātmā tā vubhau narakaṃ vrajet //
analyzed: dadāti ca anyaḥ duṣṭa ātmā tau ubhau narakam vrajet
translated: and another evil-minded one who gives it, both of them would go to hell.

original: saṅkareṣu ca sarveṣu cetasaḥ śuddhi kāraṇaṃ /🔽p /
analyzed: saṅkareṣu ca sarveṣu cetasaḥ śuddhi kāraṇam  p
translated: In all mixtures, the cause of purification of the mind

analyzed: aghora mantraḥ japtavyaḥ yāvat cittam prasīdati
translated: is the japa of the Aghora mantra until the mind becomes tranquil.

analyzed: japa tīrtha upavāsa ādya śiva āyatana yogataḥ
translated: Japa, pilgrimage, fasting, etc. are done in conjunction with a Shiva temple.

analyzed: gaḍḍukānām pradānena tila ājya vahanena tu
translated: By the gift of gaddukas, by the conveyance of sesame and ghee,

analyzed: ācārya sannidhānena saṃhitā śravaṇena tu
translated: By the presence of the Acharya, by listening to the Samhita,

original: devadvija go śivāya pañca gagane na ca //
analyzed: deva dvija go śivāya pañca gagane na ca
translated: And by the five nectars to the gods, Brahmins, cows and Shiva,

analyzed: megha muktyaḥ yathā bhānuḥ tadvat loke virājate
translated: Just as the sun shines in the world when released from the clouds,

analyzed: tasmāt adyāni vṛtti artham prāyaścittam samācaret
translated: Therefore, for the sake of livelihood, one should perform the expiation.

original: iti vā kule mahātantrai āgneyākhyaṃ sāmānyaprāyaścittavidhānaṃ // //
analyzed: iti vā kule mahā tantraiḥ āgneya ākhyam sāmānya prāyaścitta vidhānam
translated: Thus ends the general expiation rite called Agni in the great Tantra of the Kula.

original: liṅgantu trividhaṃ viddhi vyaktā bhakto bhayā kṛtiḥ /
analyzed: liṅgam tu trividham viddhi vyaktā bhaktaḥ bhayā kṛtiḥ
translated: Know that the Linga is of three kinds - the manifest, the devotee, and the fearful.

analyzed: liṅga medaḥ na vaktavyaḥ prāyaścitta
translated: The Linga should not be mentioned in the expiation rite.

analyzed: ekaḥ śivaḥ trayāṇām tu saṃsthitaḥ tattva bhedata
translated: Shiva is one, but is established in three due to the difference in principles.

original: prāyaścitta vidhau vatsa liṅgabhedaṃ tataḥ śṛṇuḥ //
analyzed: prāyaścitta vidhau vatsa liṅga bhedam tatas śṛṇuḥ
translated: O child, listen to the classification of Lingas in the expiation rite.

analyzed: yāgeśvaram ca
translated: And the lord of sacrifice

analyzed: sthitam ca āsthāpya mānam ca vidhi vā valim ādiśet
translated: Having established and measured, one should direct the rite and the offering.

analyzed: svayam vai sva iṣṭa liṅge tu aparādhi viśodhakam
translated: In one's own beloved Linga, the purifier of the offender,

analyzed: paraiḥ kṛta iparādhe ca śuddhiḥ tatra vidhīyate
translated: And in the offense committed by others, purification is prescribed there.

analyzed: sva iṣṭa liṅge sādhakena dvayasya atra viśodhanam
translated: In one's own beloved Linga, the purification of both is done by the practitioner here.

original: aparādhi vidhau jñeyāḥ svakṛtaścāparai kṛtaḥ /🔽ekaiko dvividho jñeyaḥ sa kāmākāya bhedataḥ //
analyzed: aparādhi vidhau jñeyāḥ sva kṛtaḥ ca aparaiḥ kṛtaḥ  ekaikaḥ dvividhaḥ jñeyaḥ sa kāmākāya bhedataḥ
translated: The offences committed by oneself and by others should be known in the ritual.🔽Each should be known as of two kinds, due to the distinction of desire and non-desire.

analyzed: dvividhaḥ saḥ api vijñeyaḥ bhautikaḥ naiṣṭhikaḥ tathā
translated: That should also be known as of two kinds, as worldly and spiritual.

analyzed: caturddhā seyaḥ samaya ādyaiḥ ca bhedataḥ
translated: The worldly one is of four kinds, due to the distinction of samaya etc.

original: liṅga na parādhakaraṇā śodhanaṃ kathyate punaḥ /
analyzed: śodhanam kathyate punar
translated: The purification of the movable and immovable lingas due to offences is not described again.

analyzed: cala āsthāpyā cala āsthāpyā dviguṇam pariśodhanam
translated: The purification of the movable and immovable is double.

analyzed: pūrva siddhe cale murddhniḥ dviguṇā asya prakalpayet
translated: On the movable head that is previously accomplished, one should assign double.

analyzed: sthire caturguṇam vatsa prāk śuddhi śuddhim ādiśet
translated: O child, on the immovable, it is four times. One should first direct the purification.

original: sādhāraṇā tathā sādhyā dviguṇā śuddhirīritā /🔽p / 🔽dvaitādvaita saṃjñā tu dviguṇāṃ śuddhimādiśet //
analyzed: sādhāraṇā tathā sādhyā dviguṇā śuddhiḥ īritā  p  tu dviguṇām śuddhim ādiśet
translated: The purification of the common and the to-be-accomplished is said to be double.🔽The one known as dualistic and non-dualistic should be directed to have double purification.

analyzed: yā tu sādhāraṇāt śuddhiḥ dviguṇā tat vinā matāḥ
translated: The purification that is common is considered double, and that is considered without it.

original: sveṣṭa liṅgāparādhastu pare reva kṛto yadā //
analyzed: sva iṣṭa liṅga aparādhaḥ tu pare reva kṛtaḥ yadā
translated: When an offence against one's own desired linga is committed by another,

analyzed: dviguṇam sva kṛte prāhuḥ prāyaścittam
translated: they say that the penance for one's own is double for the sake of purification.

analyzed: niṣkāmaḥ ca sa kāmaḥ ca svayam eva aparaḥ tha vā
translated: One who is desireless and one who is desirous, either by oneself or by another,

original: jñātvā jñātvā prakarttavyāmprāyaścittaṃ śikhidhvajaḥ /🔽sādhakebhyo dīkṣitasya śodhanaṃ dviguṇaṃ mataṃ //
analyzed: jñātvā jñātvā prakarttavyām prāyaścittam śikhidhvajaḥ  sādhakebhyaḥ dīkṣitasya śodhanam dviguṇam matam
translated: Having known, one should perform the expiation.🔽For a consecrated person, the purification is considered twice that of the practitioners.

analyzed: bhautikāt brahmacārīṇām śodhanam dviguṇam matam
translated: For householders, the purification is considered twice that of celibate students.

analyzed: varṇeṣu varṇa vāhyeṣu dṛṣṭa liṅge viśodhanam
translated: For those outside the caste system, the purification is by seeing the liṅga.

analyzed: tathā evasya viśodhanam
translated: Similarly, for one with the three liṅgas, the purification is by seeing.

original: tathaivasya śite liṅge śodhanaṃ purataḥ śṛṇu /
analyzed: tathā eva asya śite liṅge śodhanam puratas śṛṇu
translated: Similarly, for one with the sharp liṅga, listen to the purification in front.
The group consisting of the four castes is the next one in the play.

original: yadupasparśataḥ śuddhiḥ svavarggairdvitīyo mataḥ /🔽kākādi varṇastṛtīyaḥ snānaṃ yat sparśato bhavet //
analyzed: yad upasparśataḥ śuddhiḥ sva varggaiḥ dvitīyaḥ mataḥ  kāka ādi varṇaḥ tṛtīyaḥ snānam yat sparśataḥ bhavet
translated: The second is considered to be purified by the touch of one's own group.🔽The third caste is that of crows etc., where purification is by the touch of bathing.

analyzed: śvapava ādiḥ caturthaḥ tu sa sparśataḥ yatas
translated: The fourth is that of dogs etc., because it is by the touch of the clothes.

analyzed: darśanam sparśanam vatsa caturvargaiḥ vivarjitam
translated: O child, the sight and touch are devoid of the four groups.

analyzed: liṅga āśritānām doṣāṇām pramāṇam kathyate punar
translated: The measure of the faults related to the liṅga is again stated,

analyzed: yeṣu saṃjāta mātreṣu prāyaścittī bhavet naraḥ
translated: in which, as soon as they arise, a person becomes subject to expiation.

analyzed: prāyaścittam purā jñeyam liṅga chāyāt na laṃghayet
translated: The expiation should be known first, one should not cross the shadow of the liṅga.

analyzed: śatatraguṇa śuddhiḥ syāt aghoreṇa na ca anyathā
translated: Purification would be hundred times more with Aghora, not otherwise.

analyzed: sahasrā site śuddhiḥ dviguṇam parivarttanāt
translated: Purification is thousand times more with double the number of repetitions.

analyzed: liṅge vivṛte tu mahi tale
translated: If the penis is cut off or torn, or if the ground is torn,

original: śuciścaivā yute naiva lakṣāt svabhradhyute śuciḥ /
analyzed: śuciḥ ca evā yute na eva lakṣāt śuciḥ
translated: one is not pure even with a lakh of repetitions. One is pure only if the ground is raised.

analyzed: abhighāte tu saṃjāte dvi ayutāt śucim ādiśet
translated: If a blow is received, one should declare purity after two myriads.

analyzed: adūrāt ayute na eva abhighātāt śuciḥ bhavet
translated: If the blow is not far, one becomes pure after a myriad.

analyzed: pāda sparśe laṃghane ca dvi ayutāt śuddhim ādiśet
translated: If there is contact with the foot or jumping, one should declare purity after two myriads.

original: arddhāt pādarajaḥ sparśe śuddhiḥ syānnānyathā guha /
analyzed: arddhāt pāda rajaḥ sparśe śuddhiḥ syāt na anyathā guha
translated: O Guha, if there is contact with half the foot-dust, there is purity, not otherwise.

original: ayutācchūkṣma dṛṣṭe tu dvyakurā tu tadambhasā //🔽sūtre sūtrodake naiva lakṣārddhāt pādataḥ śuciḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭe tu dvi akurā tu tad ambhasā  sūtre sūtra udake nā eva lakṣa arddhāt pādataḥ śuciḥ
translated: If the fine dust is seen after ten thousand, it is two myriads with that water.🔽If there is contact with the thread or water of the thread, one is pure after half a lakh or a quarter.

original: rakta rajasvalā sparśāllakṣārddhācchuddhiracitā //🔽p / 🔽tatsaṃyuktodaka sparśāt pādonāpūrvavat śuciḥ /
analyzed: rakta rajasvalā sparśāt lakṣa arddhāt śuddhi racitā  p  tad saṃyukta udaka sparśāt pādona ūna a pūrva vat śuciḥ
translated: If there is contact with blood or a menstruating woman, purity is after half a lakh, if not done.🔽If there is contact with water mixed with that, one is pure after less than a quarter, as before.

analyzed: viṣṭa asparśāt tathā lakṣāt pāda ūnān tu tad ambhaśā
translated: Similarly, if there is contact with feces, one is pure after half a lakh, but with its water after less than a quarter.

analyzed: tathā nirmālya gartte tu patitāt śuddhim ādiśet
translated: Similarly, if one has fallen into a pit of discarded offerings, one should declare purity.

original: viṣṭhāgartte nipātācca sārddha lakṣācchucirmatā //🔽sthirasyo nyūlanāllakṣācchuddhiḥ syāt sthāpanāstathā /
analyzed: viṣṭhā gartte nipātāt ca sārddha lakṣāt śuciḥ matā  sthirasyaḥ nyūlanāt lakṣāt śuddhiḥ syāt sthāpanāḥ tathā
translated: And by falling into a pit of feces, one is considered pure after half a lakh.🔽For a fixed (image), purification would be after a lakh by removing it, and likewise by re-establishing it.

analyzed: samudbhava antara sthaḥ api samuṅgaka vivarjitaiḥ
translated: Even if it is inside a well, without a hole,

original: samuṅgakaistu liṅge tu pramādāt patite sati /
analyzed: samuṅgakaiḥ tu liṅge tu pramādāt patite sati
translated: if a linga falls due to negligence,

analyzed: haste kalpam
translated: the purification is half a lakh for a handspan, and more or less than that.

analyzed: samudraka vihīne tu hastāt tu patite śive
translated: If Shiva falls from a handspan, without a hole,

analyzed: pramāṇāt ca pūrva uktā dviguṇāt śuciḥ
translated: and the measurement is more than a handspan, one is pure after twice the previously mentioned (purification).

analyzed: ayutāt api na ālīḍhe yadi hīyete
translated: If there is no loss of luster even after ten thousand,

original: kānti hīne śucirlakṣīt parityāge kṛte pare //
analyzed: kānti hīne parityāge kṛte pare
translated: if there is loss of luster, one is purified after a lakh, if another is abandoned.

analyzed: vyaṅgita iṣpatha vicchāye nadī garbha ādi pānataḥ
translated: If the luster and complexion are lost due to drinking the womb of a river, etc.,

analyzed: hṛte patite mahā martte pramādataḥ
translated: if it is stolen, lost, or fallen due to great negligence,

original: śvakākālīḍhite mīve vātha śucistathā /🔽hṛte rātrau taskarairvāśca pacaivārthaseṣite //
analyzed: śva kāka āliḍhite mīve vā atha śuciḥ tathā  hṛte rātrau taskaraiḥ vā āśca paca eva artha seṣite
translated: if it is licked by a dog or crow, one is pure likewise.🔽If it is stolen at night by thieves, the purification is the same if the purpose is served.

analyzed: viruddha varga dvitaye spṛṣṭe tyāgī vidhīyate
translated: If it is touched by two contradictory groups, abandonment is prescribed.

analyzed: japet yatnāt tad rūpam sthāpayet punar
translated: One should then recite the mantra one lakh times and re-establish the form with effort.

analyzed: tadā śuddhim m avāpnoti sādhaka udagdha kilviṣaḥ
translated: Then the practitioner becomes purified and his sins are burnt.

analyzed: anyathā nā eva mucyete
translated: Otherwise, they are not liberated due to the possibility of various obstacles.

analyzed: evam vai ca akṣasūtrasya prāyaścittam samācaret
translated: Thus, one should perform the expiation for the rosary.

original: prāgukta liṃgapādena śuddhiṃ tatra samādiśet //🔽liṅgāṣṭāṃśena praṇāyāmapārādheṣu liṅgavat /
analyzed: prāc ukta liṃga pādena śuddhim tatra samādiśet
translated: The purification should be prescribed there by the guru as mentioned earlier.

analyzed: prāyaścittam pradātavyam guruṇā tatva vedinā
translated: For the faults in breath control, the expiation should be given by the guru who knows the truth, as for the liṅga, by one-eighth of the liṅga.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa ādi catur varṇaiḥ śivadīkṣā vivarjitaiḥ
translated: By those of the four castes beginning with Brahmins, who are devoid of initiation in Śiva,

analyzed: sva iṣṭa liṅgam tu yat pṛṣṭam prāyaścittam samādiśet
translated: the expiation should be prescribed for the liṅga worshipped by them.

analyzed: eka dvi tris catuḥ ca antaiḥ dvija ādyaiḥ tu śataiḥ śuciḥ
translated: The pure one becomes pure by hundreds ending with one, two, three, and four, respectively, by the twice-born etc.

analyzed: kaivartta vargau saṃspṛṣṭam sva iṣṭa liṅge pramādataḥ
translated: If the liṅga worshipped by oneself is accidentally touched by the fishermen and other classes,

analyzed: ayutāt śuddhim āpnoti sādhakaḥ na anyathā aṇuciḥ
translated: the practitioner becomes pure by ten thousand, not otherwise.

analyzed: spṛṣṭe kākādi vargaiḥ tu tri ayutāt śudhyate naraḥ  p
translated: If it is touched by crows and other classes, a man becomes pure by thirty thousand.🔽If it is seen by dogs and other classes, he becomes pure by forty thousand.

analyzed: vāṇa ayutaiḥ ca saṃśudhye dṛṣṭe tu racama ādibhiḥ
translated: If it is seen by Rācamas and other classes, he becomes pure by fifty thousand.

analyzed: caturvargeṇa saṃspṛṣṭe darśanāt viguṇāt śuciḥ
translated: If it is touched by the four classes, he becomes pure by seeing the faultless one.

original: svaśroto dīkṣitairliṅgaṃ yadā spṛṣṭaṃ na doṣabhāk /
analyzed: sva śrotaḥ dīkṣitaiḥ liṅgam yadā spṛṣṭam na doṣa bhāj
translated: If the Linga is touched by the initiated ones of one's own tradition, it does not become defiled.

analyzed: vāma dakṣiṇa mārga sthaiḥ spṛṣṭam liṃgam pramādataḥ
translated: If the Linga is touched by mistake by those who follow the left and right paths,

analyzed: ayutāt śudhyate mantrī mahāsnānena nā anyathā
translated: the reciter is purified by ten thousand (recitations of the Vidyā) and a great bath, not otherwise.

analyzed: vāma dakṣiṇa kolaiḥ ca samparkam parivarjayet
translated: One should avoid contact with those who follow the left and right (Kaula) paths.

original: śatena sparśataḥ śuddhiḥ bhāvanā dvaita varddhitaiḥ /
analyzed: śatena sparśataḥ śuddhiḥ bhāvanā dvaita varddhitaiḥ
translated: (If one does so,) one is purified by one hundred (recitations of the Vidyā) by touching (them) with the mind expanded by (the power of) devotion.

analyzed: pañcapātaka yuktānām sparśanam parivarjayet
translated: One should avoid touching those who are associated with the five sins.

original: alāpādayutācchuddhirdviguṇā sparśato matā /🔽śayanā ayutā cchuddhirbhojanāllakṣataḥ śuciḥ //
analyzed: alāpāt ayutāt śuddhiḥ dviguṇā sparśataḥ matā  śayanā ayutā śuddhiḥ bhojanāt lakṣataḥ śuciḥ
translated: (If one does so,) one is purified by ten thousand (recitations of the Vidyā) by not speaking (to them), and by twice that many (if one does speak to them) by touching (them).🔽(One is purified) by ten thousand (recitations of the Vidyā) by sleeping (with them), and by one hundred thousand (if one) eats (with them).

analyzed: śivam nindā rateṣu ca
translated: (One is purified) by ten thousand (recitations of the Vidyā) by contact with Buddhists, materialists, and those who hate Śiva,

original: sa cchāstra dūṣikānāñca patitānāmviśeṣataḥ //🔽saṃparkaṃ yatnato varjyaṃ saṃparkād dviśatācchuciḥ /
analyzed: sa chāstra dūṣikānām ca patitānām viśeṣataḥ  saṃparkam yatnatas varjyam saṃparkāt dviśatāt śuciḥ
translated: and especially with those who are fallen and slander the scriptures.

analyzed: kaulika āpālikānām tu sparśam tat parivarjayet
translated: (One is purified) by two hundred (recitations of the Vidyā) by contact (with them). One should avoid contact with those who follow the Kaula and Pāśupata paths.

analyzed: pañca adhaka ālayakāṇām vivādam na eva kārayet
translated: One should not argue with those who belong to the five lower scriptures.

analyzed: sambhoṣaṇam tathā sparśam dūratas parivarjayet
translated: One should avoid at a distance embracing and touching (them).

analyzed: tathā sāṃkhya mata āryaiḥ satkārya kṛta vaddhibhiḥ
translated: Similarly, those who are devoted to the Sankhya philosophy, who are satisfied with the doctrine of sat-karyavada (effect pre-exists in the cause),

analyzed: vivādau nā eva kartavyoḥ tat vyapeśu lolupaiḥ
translated: should not engage in disputes with those who are attached to that doctrine.

analyzed: digambaraiḥ śveta paṭaiḥ darśanam parivarjayet
translated: One should avoid the views of the Digambaras (sky-clad ones) and the Shvetapashas (white-robed ones).

analyzed: tathā bhagavetaiḥ vaktavyam parivarjayet
translated: Similarly, one should avoid the views of the Bhagavatas (followers of Vishnu).

analyzed: mūḍha ātmā yaḥ karot patha saṅgatim
translated: The foolish one who associates with the paths of the Jains,

analyzed: na sa śiva puram vrajet
translated: he will not go to the city of Shiva, but will go to hell.

original: na ceddeśaḥ prakartavyo na vivādaḥ kadācanaḥ /
analyzed: na ced deśaḥ prakartavyaḥ na vivādaḥ
translated: If one does not engage in disputes, one should not engage in disputes at all.

analyzed: yaḥ karoti samūḍha ātmā api ayutāt śuddhim āpnuyāt
translated: The foolish one who does so will attain purification after ten thousand years.

analyzed: yatra vai tatra bhūyaḥ anurodhanam
translated: Where there are one hundred thousand verses, there should be further reverence.

original: mahāsnānaṃ tadarśa tu mahāpūjā tu pādataḥ //
analyzed: mahāsnānam tat darśa tu mahāpūjā tu pādataḥ
translated: The great ablution is there, and the great worship is at the end of each chapter.

analyzed: payaḥ dadhi ghṛta ādīnām tu
translated: With two thousand palas of milk, curd, ghee, and so on,

analyzed: mahāsnānam prakarttavyam mahā triphalā saṃyutam  p
translated: the great ablution should be performed, along with the three great fruits.

analyzed: kallola jāti punnāga śrīphalānām tathā eva ca
translated: With the leaves of the Kallola tree, Punnaga flowers, and Shriphala fruits,

analyzed: śivasya agre prakalpayet
translated: one should offer them in front of Shiva, along with the great Vartis and the Vartis.

analyzed: divya gandha samanvitā
translated: Along with red sticks and divine fragrances.

analyzed: mahāsnānam samākhyātam mahā pūjām tat arddhata
translated: The great bath is mentioned, the great worship is half of that.

analyzed: upavāsam dvayam kāryam ayute kriyate sadā
translated: Two fasts should be observed, always performed in ten thousand.

analyzed: daśa aṃśena japāt vomam viṃśati aṃśena gaḍḍukāt
translated: By one-tenth of the japa, by one-twentieth of the gadduka,

analyzed: satyam vratam brahmacarye bhojanam
translated: Truth, vow, celibacy, sleeping on the ground, eating at night,

analyzed: tila abhyaṃgam parityāgaḥ satya vāc ha viṣān nu bhuj
translated: Abandoning oil massage, speaking the truth, and eating ghee.

analyzed: kurvīta śāstra nipuṇaḥ japa antam yāvat eva hi
translated: One skilled in the scriptures should perform this up to the end of the japa.

analyzed: prāyaścittam avāpnoti paṃcagavya aśanam hitam
translated: One attains expiation, and it is beneficial to eat the five products of the cow.

analyzed: pūjayet kramāt
translated: One should worship the preceptor in sequence with land, jewels, drinks, and garments.

analyzed: prāyaścittam yadā kuvāt yadi
translated: When expiation is prescribed, if the performer dies,

analyzed: prārthya anyāḥ ca eva kartavyaḥ yathā uktāt dviguṇam punar
translated: The other rites should be performed again, twice as stated.

original: maprārtha naiva karttavyā guruṇā tatra kovida //
analyzed: na eva karttavyāḥ guruṇā tatra kovida
translated: The preceptor, skilled in that, should not perform the unrequested rites.

analyzed: śiva vat pūjayet kintu sya gurum śiva śāsane
translated: But in the Shaiva scriptures, one should worship one's guru as if he were Shiva.

analyzed: vṛddhānām bhoginām vyādhita ātmanām
translated: For children, those with curly hair, the aged, the wealthy, and those with diseased minds,

analyzed: strīṇām tu kārukānām tu prāyaścit atra vidyate
translated: But for women and artisans, there is no expiation.

original: yato nirvājikā dīkṣā teṣu kāryā na cā parā //
analyzed: yatas nirvājikā dīkṣā teṣu kāryā na parā
translated: Because their initiation is without obstacles, and no other is necessary.

analyzed: samayācāra ratā dīkṣā eva mokṣa idā matā
translated: Those who are devoted to the conduct of the rules, their initiation alone is considered to lead to liberation.

original: nirapekṣā tu sā dīkṣā sā prekṣā vīja saṃyutā //🔽sakāmāṃ samayārthānāṃ vīśajā deśikeṣvapi /
analyzed: nirapekṣā tu sā dīkṣā sā prekṣā vīja saṃyutā  sa kāmām samaya arthānām vīśa jāḥ deśikeṣu api
translated: But that initiation is independent, and that initiation is considered to be endowed with the seed.

analyzed: striyāḥ vasoḥ dvayoḥ bhaktyā liṅga arcana ratāḥ sadā
translated: For those who desire worldly enjoyments and liberation, the worship of the liṅga is always enjoined by the preceptors.

analyzed: vyatikrame samutpanne prāyaścittam pradāpayet
translated: If a transgression occurs, one should give the expiation.

analyzed: prāk uktam pādataḥ teṣām prāyaścittena śodhanam
translated: The purification of them is by the expiation mentioned earlier, by a quarter.

analyzed: aśaktitaḥ nyatas pūjyam samayī putraka ādibhiḥ
translated: One who is unable should be worshipped by the disciples and spiritual sons, etc.

original: svapotaḥ saṃsthitaiḥ pūjyanna pūjyamvā sa dakṣiṇaiḥ //
analyzed: sva potaḥ saṃsthitaiḥ pūjyan na pūjyam vā sa dakṣiṇaiḥ
translated: One who has completed his own vow should be worshipped, or one who is not to be worshipped, with gifts.

analyzed: niyoktavyaḥ pūjaḥ jāpya ādi karmasu
translated: One's own guru should not be employed in the rites of worship, japa, etc.

analyzed: sva guruḥ śiva vat pūjyaḥ bhrābhṛ vyādeśika ādayaḥ  p
translated: One's own guru should be worshipped like Śiva, and the preceptor and others like one's brother.

analyzed: sādhakāḥ tat vai deva uktāḥ
translated: The adepts are said to be like the gods, and the spiritual sons and brothers are like the disciples.

analyzed: śiva vat samaya sthāḥ ca draṣṭavyāḥ śivam icchatā
translated: Those who abide by the rules should be seen like Śiva by one who desires Śiva.

analyzed: śānti ādau deśikāḥ yojyāḥ pratiṣṭhāyām viśeṣataḥ
translated: The preceptors should be engaged in the rites of peace etc., especially in the installation.

original: śodhane ca tathā yojyāḥ sādhakāsteṣva bhāvataḥ //
analyzed: śodhane ca tathā yojyāḥ sādhakāḥ bhāvataḥ
translated: The sādhakas should be engaged in the purification rites, if they are not available.

analyzed: svakīye parakīye tu niyojyāḥ suśiva arcane
translated: One's own disciples or others should be engaged in the worship of Śiva.

analyzed: samayī putrakaḥ vā atha na aśnīyāt pūjanam vinā
translated: One who is initiated should not eat without worshipping.

original: avaśca purato devaḥ saṃpūjyaḥ sūtake sati /
analyzed: avas ca puratas devaḥ saṃpūjyaḥ sūtake sati
translated: If there is pollution, the deity should be worshipped in the east or in front.

analyzed: gṛhiṇā saha saṃyogī sūta kīṭena na anyathā
translated: One who is in union with a householder becomes polluted, not otherwise.

original: parakīye vā śeddūre tadā yojyastu pūjane /
analyzed: parakīye vā tadā yojyaḥ tu pūjane
translated: If there is pollution in others' houses, one should be engaged in worship from a distance.

analyzed: sūtaka anna ādi japtvā pramāṇena sūtakī
translated: Having recited the mantras of the polluted food etc., the pollution is purified according to the scriptures.

analyzed: antaryāgam prakarttavyam sūtake na anyathā śuciḥ
translated: The inner sacrifice should be performed during pollution, not otherwise.

analyzed: praṇamaḥ tena na gītaiḥ ca stotavyaḥ parameśvaraḥ
translated: The Supreme Lord should be praised with salutations, songs and hymns.

analyzed: śikhā chede kṛte śaktyai pūrṇāhutyā āha yojane
translated: When the tuft is cut, the disciple should be engaged in the union with the full oblation to Śakti.

analyzed: ṣaṣ adhvare pramāṇāt ca cāreṇa ṣoḍhā itikaiḥ
translated: According to the scriptures, the six paths should be purified by the movements of the breath in the ṣoḍhāvidhi.

original: sūtakaṃ mṛtakaṃ teṣāṃ na kalpyaṃ śivapūjanaṃ //
analyzed: sūtakam mṛtakam teṣām na kalpyam śiva pūjanam
translated: For them, there is no pollution or death, and Śiva worship is not appropriate.

original: pūjākāle tu devasya vipuṣoṅge patanti ye /
analyzed: pūjā kāle tu devasya vipuṣā uṅge patanti ye
translated: Those who fall on the body of the deity at the time of worship,

analyzed: prāyaścittam tadā kāryam yathā anu krama yogataḥ
translated: then expiation should be performed according to the proper sequence.

analyzed: āpāda jānu paryantam sadyojātaḥ tu saptadhā
translated: From the feet up to the knees, one should remember the Sadyojata form seven times.

analyzed: saṃsmaret vidhivat mantri śudhyate na anyathā kvacid
translated: The reciter should purify himself in this way, not otherwise.

analyzed: jānunī guhya paryyantam vipreṣu age tu saṃsmaret
translated: From the knees up to the genitals, one should remember the Vamadeva form.

analyzed: kalāmantram na ca aparam
translated: One should recite the Kalamantratraya (three times) and not any other mantra.

analyzed: āguhyāt hṛdayāt tantu bahu rūpam tathā smaret
translated: From the genitals up to the heart, one should remember the Aghora form.

original: trisapta vārānvāmantu kalāmantraṃ na cāparaṃ //🔽āguhyā hṛdayāntantu bahurūpaṃ tathā smaret /
analyzed: tri sapta kalā mantram na ca aparam  āguhya hṛdaya antam tu bahu rūpam tathā smaret
translated: One should recite the Kalamantratraya and not any other mantra.🔽From the genitals up to the heart, one should remember the Aghora form.

analyzed: hṛdaya āt mastakāt tantu siktam ced snāna mācaret
translated: If one is sprinkled with water from the heart up to the head, one should perform the ablution.

original: īśānasya śataṃ jāpyaṃ śuddhi yāti na cānyathā /
analyzed: īśānasya śatam jāpyam śuddhi yāti na ca anyathā
translated: One should repeat the Ishana mantra one hundred times for purification, not otherwise.

analyzed: akāmā bhautikaḥ yaḥ tu kuryāt nirmālyam saṃghanāt  p
translated: If a person who is not a devotee of Shiva were to eat the remnants of an offering to Shiva,

original: tasyā yutena śuddhiḥ syāccheṣeṣu triṣu pūrvavat /
analyzed: tasyāḥ yutena śuddhiḥ syāt śeṣeṣu triṣu pūrvavat
translated: he should perform one hundred thousand Japa of the Ishana mantra. For the other three, it is as before.

analyzed: devacaṇḍa guru dravyam bhakṣitam yat ca kāmataḥ
translated: If one were to eat the property of a deity, a Chandala, or a Guru out of desire,

original: bhautiko lakṣa jāpena śuciḥ śeṣāstu pūrvavat /
analyzed: bhautikaḥ lakṣa jāpena śuciḥ śeṣāḥ tu pūrvavat
translated: a non-devotee becomes pure by reciting the Ishana mantra one lakh times, while for the other three it is as before.

analyzed: devacaṇḍa guru dravyam bhakṣitam kāmataḥ
translated: If one were to eat the property of a deity, a Chandala, or a Guru out of desire,

original: bhautiko lakṣa jāpena śuciḥ śeṣāstu pūrvavat /
analyzed: bhautikaḥ lakṣa jāpena śuciḥ śeṣāḥ tu pūrvavat
translated: One who has committed the sin of eating the remnants of food offered to Śiva should perform one lakh japa of the mantra of Śiva. The other penances are the same as before.

original: yannirmālyena saṃspṛṣṭaṃ na guhyāt puruṣeṇa vā //🔽pādonāntu pramādācca prāyaścittī bhavennaraḥ /
analyzed: yat nirmālyena saṃspṛṣṭam na guhyāt puruṣeṇa vā  pāda ūnān tu pramādāt ca prāyaścittī bhavet naraḥ
translated: If one touches the remnants of food offered to Śiva or a secret mantra or a man,🔽one should perform a penance equal to one-fourth of the penance prescribed for the sin of eating the remnants of food offered to Śiva.

analyzed: pramāde bhakṣaṇe tulye
translated: If one eats the remnants of food offered to Śiva unintentionally, the penance is half of that prescribed for eating the remnants of food offered to Śiva.

original: gurudeva dvijātīnāndravyaṃ yatnena rakṣayet /🔽advaitaṃ pūjayed yastu dvaitaliṅge pramādataḥ //
analyzed: guru deva dvijātīnām dravyam yatnena rakṣayet  advaitam pūjayet yaḥ tu dvaita liṅge pramādataḥ
translated: One should carefully protect the property of one's guru, gods and Brahmins.

analyzed: tritayeṣu api pūrvavat
translated: If one worships non-dualism with a dualistic attitude, one should perform one lakh japa of the mantra of Śiva. The penance is the same for all three types of sins.

analyzed: evam vai nirācāraiḥ vivarjayet
translated: Thus, one should avoid dualistic mantras and non-observance of rules.

original: varninaṃ pātre tu saṅge cātha vivarjite /
analyzed: varninam pātre tu saṅge ca atha vivarjite
translated: If one eats the remnants of food offered to Śiva in a vessel belonging to a person of a different caste, one should perform a penance.

analyzed: śata dvayāt sahasra arddha anta dardvāt kramatas śuciḥ
translated: One becomes pure by performing one hundred and twenty-five japas of the mantra of Śiva. The penance is half of that for eating the remnants of food offered to Śiva.

original: dviguṇaṃ sthaṇḍile prāhustastālekṣe hutāsane /🔽avisarjita pātre tu prāyaścittaṃ vinirddiśet //
analyzed: dviguṇam sthaṇḍile prāhuḥ taḥ tāla īkṣe hutāsane  a visarjita pātre tu prāyaścittam vinirddiśet
translated: The penance is double for eating the remnants of food offered to Śiva on the ground. The penance is half of that for eating the remnants of food offered to Śiva in a vessel belonging to a person of a different caste.🔽If one eats the remnants of food offered to Śiva in a vessel not belonging to oneself, one should perform a penance.

analyzed: śiva agnim dhārayet yatnāt praśāntaḥ ced pramādataḥ
translated: If one unintentionally disregards the sacred fire of Śiva,

analyzed: aghorasya yutam jāpyam tadā śuddhiḥ na ca anyathā
translated: one should perform ten thousand japas of the mantra of Aghora. Then one becomes pure, not otherwise.

analyzed: dviguṇaḥ jāpāḥ karttavyāḥ tu viśeṣataḥ
translated: The recitations should be doubled, especially for the two.

analyzed: kīṭa āmiṣa ādi naivedya darśanāt śa tatas śuciḥ
translated: One becomes pure by seeing the offerings of insects, meat, etc.

analyzed: pramāda āmiṣa dānena bahu rūpā yutāt śuciḥ
translated: One becomes pure by the gift of meat out of negligence, united with many forms.

original: śataṃ prāṇāṅga dhūpe tu pañcamaṃ parivarttayet //
analyzed: śatam dhūpe tu pañcamam parivarttayet
translated: In the case of incense, one should recite the fifth one hundred times.

analyzed: pātra abhighāte dvi śatam japtavyam dakṣiṇasya tu
translated: In the case of striking the vessel, two hundred should be recited on the right side.

analyzed: tri paṃca saptadaśabhiḥ ācāryaiḥ tatra pāragaiḥ
translated: There, the preceptors who have mastered the three, five, seven, and ten,

analyzed: sva śāstra niyata atyāśaiḥ prāyaścittam pradāpayet
translated: who are restrained by their own scriptures, should perform the expiation.

analyzed: na mūrkhe
translated: Not to a fool, not to one who procrastinates, not to an atheist, or to one who reasons,

original: yathā śāstropadiṣṭaṃ tu nanyūnaṃ nādhikaṃ kvacit /
analyzed: yathā śāstra upadiṣṭam tu na nyūnam na adhikam kvacid
translated: As instructed in the scriptures, not less, not more anywhere.

analyzed: deśikaḥ narakam vrajet  p
translated: By offering less, etc., the guide would go to hell.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva prayatnena yathoktantu samācaret
translated: Therefore, with all effort, one should do as stated.

analyzed: iti vāthule mahā tantre prāyaścitta paṭalam samāptam
translated: Thus ends the chapter on expiation in the great tantra of Vātula.

analyzed: prāyaścitti ukti krameṇa asti samuccaya manyaiḥ sadbhiḥ udīritam
translated: The combination is stated by many good people in the order of stating the expiations.

original: śāstrebhyaḥ saṃgṛhya mayāpi tathaivoktaṃ kintu sāraṃ samāsataḥ //
analyzed: śāstrebhyaḥ saṃgṛhya mayā api tathā evā uktam kintu sāram samāsatas
translated: I have also stated it in the same way after collecting it from the scriptures, but in brief, the essence.

analyzed: sārāḥ samuccayāḥ sadbhiḥ saṃskṛtya santi anekaśas
translated: The good people have compiled many collections of the essence.

original: kṛteṣu cet kṛtisteṣāmasmākaṃ ca tathā kṛtiḥ //
analyzed: kṛteṣu ced kṛtiḥ teṣām asmākam ca tathā kṛtiḥ
translated: If they have done it, then we have also done it in the same way.

original: mattamayūravaṃśaje śrīraṇi padralamvakarṇa iti nāma prathitaḥ pṛthivyāṃ🔽muniḥ /
analyzed: matta mayūra vaṃśa je śrī raṇi padralamvakarṇaḥ iti nāma prathitaḥ pṛthivyām  muniḥ
translated: The sage named Sri Ranipadralambakarṇa, born in the peacock-like family of Matta, is famous on earth.
He is the purifier of the ears of all the good people who have studied the Shaiva philosophy.
He has a matted topknot marked by the moon and is the son-in-law of Shankara who resides in Kailash.

analyzed: śrī raṇi padraka āśramāt gorāṭika maṭhe gamat
translated: From the hermitage of Sri Ranipadralambaka, he went to the math at Gorika.

analyzed: dhārāyāṃsīyakam iti anujagrāha pārthivaḥ
translated: In Dharā, the king honored him as Sīyaka.

original: āsīttatsantatau muniḥ śrī īśvara śiva iti jagatīpatibhirnṛpaiḥ🔽pūjitapādapaṅkajaḥ //🔽tacchiṣyo nikhilāgamārtha vimalādarśo muniḥ śrīhṛdaya śiva iti vidyeśvara
analyzed: āsīt tad santatau muniḥ śrī īśvara śivaḥ iti jagatīpatibhiḥ nṛpaiḥ  pūjita pāda paṅkajaḥ  tad śiṣyaḥ nikhila āgama artha vimala ādarśaḥ muniḥ śrī hṛdaya śivaḥ iti vidyeśvara
translated: In his lineage, there was a sage named Sri Ishvara Shiva, whose lotus feet were worshipped by the kings, the rulers of the world.

analyzed: tulya kīrtiḥ
translated: His disciple was the sage Sri Hṛdaya Shiva, a mirror of the meaning of all the scriptures, equal in fame to the lord of knowledge.

original: yasyocchrito dikṣu tapaḥ prabhāva udīcyate sādhujanairjagatyāṃ
analyzed: yasya ucchritaḥ dikṣu tapaḥ prabhāvaḥ udīcyate sādhu janaiḥ jagatyām
translated: His fame and the power of his austerities are proclaimed by the good people in the world in all directions.
The essence of the scriptures, lifted up with ease, scratching the itch of heretical arguments with a snap.

analyzed: viracitam aneka saṅgrāma saṃghaṭṭa koṭi nihita akhila dvipi
translated: Those two have composed this, having defeated all elephants in many millions of battles.

analyzed: prāyaścitta samuccayaḥ samāptam iti
translated: The Collection of Expiations is complete.
